title: Opinion: India Can Do A Lot With BRICS - If It Doesn't Let China Run The Show
content: China and Russia are pushing BRICS to become a decidedly anti-West bloc. The recent inclusion of anti-West Iran, at their behest, is a case in point.
summary: China and Russia are pushing BRICS to become a decidedly anti-West bloc. The recent inclusion of anti-West Iran, at their behest, is a case in point.

title: Noel Tata Takes Over From Ratan Tata. Know The Tata Ancestry And History
content: Founded in 1868, Tatas have become one of largest and most diverse global conglomerates. It is a name heard in almost every home in India and tens of millions overseas.
summary: Founded in 1868, Tatas have become one of largest and most diverse global conglomerates. It is a name heard in almost every home in India and tens of millions overseas.

title: Nuclear Weapons Don't Bring Peace, Warns Nobel-Winning Atomic Bomb Survivor
content: Nuclear weapons never bring peace, said the co-chair of Nihon Hidankyo, a group of atomic bomb survivors from Hiroshima and Nagasaki that won the Nobel Peace Prize on Friday.
summary: Nuclear weapons never bring peace, said the co-chair of Nihon Hidankyo, a group of atomic bomb survivors from Hiroshima and Nagasaki that won the Nobel Peace Prize on Friday.

title: Belgian Military Evacuates 100 Europeans From Lebanon
content: More than 100 Europeans were evacuated from Lebanon on a Belgian military plane on Thursday evening, most of them from Belgium, the Netherlands and France, the government in Brussels said.
summary: More than 100 Europeans were evacuated from Lebanon on a Belgian military plane on Thursday evening, most of them from Belgium, the Netherlands and France, the government in Brussels said.

title: Research Reveals "Headspin Hole": A Hidden Risk Of Breakdancing
content: A case report in the BMJ details the first known case of the “breakdance bulge” – a benign tumour on the scalp, caused by the repeated friction and pressure exerted during headspins.
summary: A case report in the BMJ details the first known case of the “breakdance bulge” – a benign tumour on the scalp, caused by the repeated friction and pressure exerted during headspins.

title: ISRO, NASA Discover Stunning Eruptions From Black Hole's Stellar Wreckage
content: Astronomers have observed a spectacular cosmic event where a massive black hole is disrupting two celestial objects, one of which was a star.
summary: Astronomers have observed a spectacular cosmic event where a massive black hole is disrupting two celestial objects, one of which was a star.

title: Nobel Peace Prize 2024 Goes To Japanese Organisation Nihon Hidankyo
content: Nihon Hidankyo is a grassroots movement of atomic bomb survivors from Hiroshima and Nagasaki which strives to "achieve a world free of nuclear weapons".
summary: Nihon Hidankyo is a grassroots movement of atomic bomb survivors from Hiroshima and Nagasaki which strives to "achieve a world free of nuclear weapons".

title: TikTok Cuts Hundreds Of Jobs In Shift Towards AI Content Moderation
content: TikTok confirmed the layoffs and said that several hundred employees were expected to be impacted globally as part of a wider plan to improve its moderation operations.
summary: TikTok confirmed the layoffs and said that several hundred employees were expected to be impacted globally as part of a wider plan to improve its moderation operations.

title: Voice Of Japan's Beloved Robot Cat 'Doraemon' Dies At 90
content: Nobuyo Oyama, a Japenese actor who was the voice of Doraemon, died on September 29 due to old age, her talent agency told news agency AFP.
summary: Nobuyo Oyama, a Japenese actor who was the voice of Doraemon, died on September 29 due to old age, her talent agency told news agency AFP.

title: Joe Biden "Courageous" To Step Out Of US Elections 2024: Kamala Harris
content: US Vice President Kamala Harris said that Joe Biden's decision to drop out of the 2024 election race this summer was "one of the most courageous" any president has made.
summary: US Vice President Kamala Harris said that Joe Biden's decision to drop out of the 2024 election race this summer was "one of the most courageous" any president has made.

title: One In Eight Girls Suffers Sexual Assault Before Turning 18, Says UNICEF
content: International Day Of Girl Child 2024: The report highlights that when "non-contact" forms of abuse - such as online harassment or verbal assault - are factored in, the number rises to 650 million, or 1 in 5.
summary: International Day Of Girl Child 2024: The report highlights that when "non-contact" forms of abuse - such as online harassment or verbal assault - are factored in, the number rises to 650 million, or 1 in 5.

title: Iran Hasn't Decided To Build A Nuclear Weapon, Believes US
content: US still believes that Iran has not decided to build a nuclear weapon despite Tehran's recent strategic setbacks, including Israel's killing of Hezbollah leaders and two largely unsuccessful attempts to attack Israel, two US officials told Reuters.
summary: US still believes that Iran has not decided to build a nuclear weapon despite Tehran's recent strategic setbacks, including Israel's killing of Hezbollah leaders and two largely unsuccessful attempts to attack Israel, two US officials told Reuters.

title: Boat Carrying Turkish Evacuees From Lebanon Lands In Turkey
content: The first of two naval ships evacuating Turkish citizens and their families from war-torn Lebanon landed at a port in southern Turkey late on Thursday, an AFP correspondent at the scene said.
summary: The first of two naval ships evacuating Turkish citizens and their families from war-torn Lebanon landed at a port in southern Turkey late on Thursday, an AFP correspondent at the scene said.

title: PM Modi Meets Antony Blinken On Sidelines Of ASEAN Summit
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday met with US Secretary of State Antony Blinken on the sidelines of the ASEAN-India Summit in Laos.
summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday met with US Secretary of State Antony Blinken on the sidelines of the ASEAN-India Summit in Laos.

title: "Approach Should Be Of Development, Not Expansion": PM At East Asia Summit
content: Noting that conflicts in different parts of the world are having the most negative impact on the countries of the Global South, Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday called for the restoration of peace and stability in Eurasia and West Asia.
summary: Noting that conflicts in different parts of the world are having the most negative impact on the countries of the Global South, Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday called for the restoration of peace and stability in Eurasia and West Asia.

title: "Nightmare Scenario": Man Rescued 48 Km Offshore After Hurricane Milton
content: A man, clinging to a cooler in the aftermath of Hurricane Milton, was saved by a Coast Guard helicopter crew on October 10, around 48 kilometres off Longboat Key.
summary: A man, clinging to a cooler in the aftermath of Hurricane Milton, was saved by a Coast Guard helicopter crew on October 10, around 48 kilometres off Longboat Key.

title: Elon Musk Unveils Robotaxi, Promises To Make It Available Before 2027
content: Elon Musk on Thursday unveiled what he said was a robotaxi capable of self-driving, predicting it would be available by 2027 -- about a decade after he first promised an autonomous vehicle.
summary: Elon Musk on Thursday unveiled what he said was a robotaxi capable of self-driving, predicting it would be available by 2027 -- about a decade after he first promised an autonomous vehicle.

title: "Yes She Can": Barack Obama Electrifies Pennsylvania Rally For Kamala Harris
content: Barack Obama cast the Republican nominee Donald Trump as a selfish businessman concerned only with his own accumulation of wealth and power, in contrast with Kamala Harris.
summary: Barack Obama cast the Republican nominee Donald Trump as a selfish businessman concerned only with his own accumulation of wealth and power, in contrast with Kamala Harris.

title: A Couple Walked Great Wall Of China From Opposite Ends Only To Break Up
content: Serbian artist Marina Abramovic and German artist Ulay started from opposite ends of the Great Wall to meet and marry, but their trek, titled The Lovers, ended as a symbol of their separation.
summary: Serbian artist Marina Abramovic and German artist Ulay started from opposite ends of the Great Wall to meet and marry, but their trek, titled The Lovers, ended as a symbol of their separation.

title: 1 Dead, 12 Trapped After Elevator Malfunction At Colorado Gold Mine
content: The incident occurred during the Mollie Kathleen Gold Mine Tour, which takes visitors 1,000 feet (300 meters) underground in the western US state.
summary: The incident occurred during the Mollie Kathleen Gold Mine Tour, which takes visitors 1,000 feet (300 meters) underground in the western US state.
